subject: Re: [junit] failing to generate error on NullPointerException
msgSnippet: ... nevermind about the classloader link, it just hit me you were prolley refering to having another parser defined in the classpath and getting conflicts that
messageBody:
> > > java.lang.NullPointerException
> > > at
> > > org.apache.xerces.parsers.AbstractSAXParser.parse(AbstractSAXParser.java:996)
> > > at com.gallup.g.LanguageHandler.load(LanguageHandler.java:109)
> >
> >
> > The words ".load" and "SAXParser" make me think of a classic ClassLoader
> > problem. Because you didn't mentioned which runner you were using, the
> > question I have is:
> >
> > - are you using the Swing application?
>
> nope.
> >
> > If you do, you should try the TextUI runner and see if you still have
> > the same problem. If the TextUI works fine, you have found the classic
> > ClassLoader bug. You can either stick with the TextUI runner or use the
> > Swing runner with the "reload class" checkbox unchecked.
>
> here is my ant target
>
> <target name="test" depends="compile">
> <junit printsummary="withOutAndErr" fork="on" timeout="120000"
> haltonfailure="no">
> <classpath refid="classpath"/>
> <formatter
> classname="org.apache.tools.ant.taskdefs.optional.junit.PlainJUnitResultFormatter"
> />
> <batchtest fork="no" todir="${test.dir}">
> <fileset dir="${build.classes.dir}">
> <include name="**/*$TEST.class" />
> </fileset>
> </batchtest>
> </junit>
> </target>
>
>
> And here is the main of the inner class:
>
> public static void main( String args[] ) {
> junit.textui.TestRunner.run( suite() );
> }
>
> I have never used the swing UI since I run all the tests automated on a
> few different computers with tinderbox.
>
> Is there any other information I could supply?
>
> And do you have a link to the Classic Classloader problem you were
> talking about?

nevermind about the classloader link, it just hit me you were prolley
refering to having another parser defined in the classpath and getting
conflicts that way...struggled with that one in the past.

Jesse
>
> Jesse
>
> P.S. I was poking through the ant bugs looking if this might be
> something from ant itself...no dice though.
>
